intro: Cerastium gracile subsp. velenovskyi, commonly known as the slender mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of white flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or arctic environments. Its compact growth habit and frost-resistant nature make it well adapted to harsh climatic conditions. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging garden settings.
